llm_text:
Why:
The model flag is driven primarily by payment_format_ach (feature: payment_format_ach; value=1) which has the largest positive SHAP (3.0887 → increase). Elevated transfer size also contributes: amount_received (11995.4; SHAP 0.8308 → increase) and amount_paid (11995.4; SHAP 0.7868 → increase). Receiving bank ID (to_bank; value=11; SHAP 0.4499 → increase) and transaction timing (dayofweek; value=5 [Saturday]; SHAP 0.3558 → increase) further raise the score. The sending bank (from_bank; value=20; SHAP -0.7736 → decrease) provides the largest mitigating effect.

Conclusion:
The alert primarily reflects an ACH transfer (payment_format_ach) of ~11,995.4 (amount_received/amount_paid) on dayofweek=5 to to_bank (ID 11), with partial mitigation from from_bank (ID 20). If ACH transfers of this size to to_bank on Saturdays are atypical for this customer or channel, a focused review is warranted.
